answers.answer: Have faith in God n everything will be fine :) watch movie, read books n pamper yourself cuz you need it.. Dont think about ur pregnancy 24/7 as that'd b disturbing.. Hope u have a smooth pregnancy :)

Yes ma'am the anterior placenta has a lot to do with it. I am on baby number 3 and always felt my kids kicking around 15 weeks and have felt but a little tap once. It's because my placenta is anterior.

Congratulations on your excellent health improvement! With my first pregnancy, and this one, small milestones really helped me ease my mind. Instead of worrying that everything would be ok for the entire pregnancy, I would set smaller goals. Things like: 100 days pregnant (random choice but it felt significant), then entering the second trimester, then reaching 23 weeks, when the baby *could* survive with medical help. I can't remember what came after that, but I did feel movement daily by then.

Thank you.  Just had another sonogram and everything is still perfect.  I am now twenty weeks two days and finally feeling my son kick regularly. Your suggestions have been very helpful.  This is a blessing from God that I never expected, so I thank him every nite!

question: My husband and I tried for years...you name it we tried it.  In March I was disgnosed with type two diabetes. In August after putting myself thru an whole lifestyle change.  I had dropped 75 pounds and gotten my A1C down from 14 to 5.7.  I wish I could say I felt great but I didn't....went to doctor who said everything was fine.  Went for my annual gyn Aug. 29.  I was pregnant, 10 weeks.   Now my problem is I want to be excitef but I can't relax, I am a nervous wreck.  I am now 19 weeks.  No cramping, but dont feel anything yet either.  I have an anteroir placenta.  Is this y.  Any tips on relaxing.  All checkups have been good but I still cant relax
title: Scared and can't relax
